./VulnRetrieve/POP3.pm

  • package VulnRetrieve::POP3
    • new
    • fetchOne
    • fetchSome
    • fetchAll

  • EOF
   1 package VulnRetrieve::POP3;
   2 
   3 use 5.008;
   4 use strict;
   5 use warnings;
   6 use Carp;
   7 
   8 use Net::POP3;
   9 
  10 use base qw(VulnRetrieve);
  11 
  12 sub new {
  13     my $class = shift;
  14     my ($username, $password, $server) = @_;
  15     my $self = {username=>$username, password=>$password, server=>$server};
  16     $self = bless $self, $class;
  17 
  18     # Note: oldest msg is first in messages hash
  19     my $pop = Net::POP3->new($server)
  20         or die "Can't open connection to $server : $!\n";
  21     defined($pop->login($username, $password)) #FIXME: apop fails with bad file descriptor
  22         or die "Can't authenticate: $!\n";
  23     $self->{messages} = $pop->list
  24         or die "Can't get list of undeleted messages: $!\n";
  25     $self->{pop} = $pop;
  26 
  27 
  28     return $self;
  29 }
  30 
  31 sub fetchOne {
  32     #In: msgid or default to 1 (oldest)
  33     #Do: fetch mesg
  34     #Out: scalar of mesg text fetched
  35     my $self = shift;
  36     my $msgid = shift || 1;
  37     my $pop = $self->{pop};
  38     
  39     # $message is a reference to an array of lines
  40     my $message = $pop->get($msgid);
  41         unless (defined $message) {
  42             warn "Couldn't fetch $msgid from server: $!\n";
  43     }
  44 
  45     $pop->delete($msgid);
  46     
  47     my $msg_txt = join('', @$message);
  48 
  49     return $msg_txt;
  50 }
  51 
  52 
  53 sub fetchSome {
  54     #In: number to fetch, 0 if all
  55     #Do: fetch num messages from oldest (1) to newest (max)
  56     #Out: array of message (text) scalars
  57 
  58     my $self = shift;
  59     my $num_to_fetch = shift;
  60     my $num_msgs= keys(%{$self->{messages}});
  61     # set to max if $num_to_fetch is > $num_msgs
  62     $num_to_fetch = $num_msgs if $num_to_fetch > $num_msgs;
  63     my @messages_text;
  64 
  65     $num_to_fetch = $num_msgs if $num_to_fetch == 0;
  66 
  67     for my $msgid (1..$num_to_fetch) {
  68          push @messages_text, ($self->fetchOne($msgid)); 
  69     }
  70 
  71     return @messages_text;
  72 
  73 }
  74 
  75 
  76 
  77 
  78 sub fetchAll { 
  79     #In: None
  80     #Do: call fetchSome(0) to grab all msgs
  81     #Out: array of message (text) scalars
  82     my $self = shift;
  83     return $self->fetchSome(0);
  84 }
  85 
  86 sub DESTROY {
  87     my $self = shift;
  88     my $pop = $self->{pop};
  89 
  90     $pop->quit();
  91 }
  92     
  93 
  94 1;
